questions.question: What is the maximum bend radius?

explanations.a: Stretch forming allows very large bend radii because the sheet is stretched, not just bent.
explanations.b: Die shape influences radius, but not the absolute maximum.
explanations.c: 30 cm is not a defined limit for stretch forming.
explanations.d: 60 cm is also not a defined limit.

questions.question: Surface distortion in stretch forming is:

explanations.a: Stretch forming produces smooth surfaces because the material is uniformly stretched.
explanations.b: Incorrect; it does not create high distortion.

questions.question: Arms of the stretch forming press can move only:

explanations.a: Arms typically swing up to 180° for wrapping around the die.
explanations.d: 360° rotation is not possible in stretch presses.

explanations.a: They can be formed but usually they twist during forming, making this incorrect.
explanations.b: Correct; non-symmetric profiles tend to twist under tension during stretch forming.
explanations.c: They can be formed, so this is incorrect.

explanations.a: A stretch press is the dedicated machine for stretch forming operations.
explanations.b: Used for different shaping operations, not stretch forming.
explanations.c: Hydraulic presses are used for other metal forming techniques.
explanations.d: Mechanical presses are not used for stretch forming.
